channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: SAP boss Christian Klein has seen the AI future. What you say will be more important than what you type
item.description: Christian Klein, CEO of SAP predicts the end of the keyboard as we enter the era of Applied AI and voice commands.

item.title: CEO of Glassdoor and Indeed parent says AI is not replacing workers: ‘We’re not seeing that kind of data at all’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Democrats Push to Impeach Kristi Noem, and Ilhan Omar Is Attacked in Minneapolis
item.description: Plus, the woman who helped make GPS possible.

item.title: Iran Killed Thousands of Protesters. Here Are Five of Their Stories.
item.description: “He went out for freedom,” said the cousin of one of those who was killed when Iranian authorities mounted a deadly crackdown on protests across the c...

item.title: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Jobs in Latest Round of Layoffs
item.description: The e-commerce giant has been cutting costs while pouring resources into building data centers to compete in the race to dominate artificial intellige...

item.title: Fed Meeting Comes at Pivotal Moment for Central Bank’s Independence
item.description: The Trump administration has unleashed a barrage of attacks on the Federal Reserve, including a criminal investigation into its chair, Jerome H. Powel...

item.title: As vet bills jump 40% in recent years, startup Snout raises $110 million for its ‘membership’ model to defray costs
item.description: Costs vary based on plan, but on average customers are paying $65 a month for Snout to help take care of vet costs upfront.

item.title: In Kherson, Ukraine, Every Step Outside Risks Death by Drone
item.description: Russian attacks on civilians in Kherson, in southern Ukraine, have forced important aspects of life to go underground, offering a vision of a postapoc...

item.title: This millennial quit her corporate 9-to-5 to pet sit—she’s now living rent-free, saving thousands a month, while earning $70 per day
item.description: Thanks to pet sitting, 32-year-old Georgina Welsh travels the world, works half the hours, and still takes home as much as she did in her corporate jo...

item.title: Gold is going up because Trump is talking down the dollar, feeding ‘the narrative of relative U.S. decline,’ UBS fears
item.description: The dollar hasn’t been this weak for years.

item.title: After Naval Drills With Iran, South Africa Faces New U.S. Attacks
item.description: The exercises were the second time in six months that President Cyril Ramaphosa appeared to be blindsided by his own military regarding relations with...

item.title: Veteran Indian Politician Among 5 Killed in Plane Crash
item.description: Ajit Pawar, the deputy chief minister of Maharashtra State, was on board a charter jet that crashed as it was coming in to land.

item.title: In Nigeria, a Catholic Bishop Tries to Tone Down the Uproar After U.S. Missile Strikes
item.description: Bishop Matthew Hassan Kukah, often called “the conscience of the nation,” has been trying to tone down the uproar after President Trump bombed a regio...
